meanings.def: to lose blood, especially from a wound or an injury
examples: He was bleeding from a gash on his head.
The small blood vessels in the nose bleed easily.

meanings.def: (in the past) to take blood from somebody as a way of treating disease
to force somebody to pay a lot of money over a period of time
examples: The company seems intent on bleeding us for every penny we have.

meanings.def: to remove air or liquid from something so that it works correctly
to spread from one area of something to another area
examples: Keep the paint fairly dry so that the colours don't bleed into each other.

meanings.def: to take away all somebody’s money
examples: The big corporations are bleeding some of these small countries dry.

meanings.def: used to say that you do not feel sympathy for somebody
examples: ‘I have to go to Brazil on business.’ ‘My heart bleeds for you!’
